Dear Mr. Gonzalez:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the violations
identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The corrective action plan is
due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact me. In
any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an acceptable
corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any questions. In
the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone immediately, please contact
the area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,
Shannon (Shay) Mavis

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction,
Section prevention; prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Description (1) A child caring institution, including private secure juvenile
justice facilities, shall establish a process improvement and
restraint reduction/elimination plan that:
1

(d) Staff must complete refresher training annually or more
frequently as needed.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff do not have restraint training completed as required.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
The Complainant is this Consultant. Information was
discovered during Corrective Action Plan (CAP) Follow-Up which
indicated staff did not complete annual restraint training as
required.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed via phone on 4/25/24. Supervisor
reported the facility only has two CPI trainers and it has been
difficult to get all staff to complete training within the limited
timeframes the trainers are available. Supervisor reported there
were staff signed up for training in December 2023, but the
training was cancelled, which caused staff to become overdue.
Supervisor reported this has been an ongoing concern and agrees
it needs to be addressed.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed via phone on 4/25/24. Supervisor
2 reported CPI cards they receive after training provide an
expiration which is over 365 days from the time they completed
training (i.e. training is completed 3/5/24, then the expiration is
listed as 12/31/25). Supervisor 2 reported their restraint policy
says training will be completed annually, but they have considered
annually once within the calendar year versus once within every
365 days. Supervisor 2 reported they’re currently working on
updating the restraint policy and will add clarification on the annual
training requirement.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Chart of TLC staff CPI training dates shows 5 employees
are overdue with their annual restraint training.
o Supervisor 1 last completed training on 3/12/23.
o Staff 1 last completed training on 10/10/22.
o Staff 2 last completed training on 2/13/23.
o Staff 3 last completed training on 10/10/22.
o Staff 4 last completed training on 3/8/23.
• Bethany Christian Services Emergency Physical Restraint
Policy and Procedures (rev. 8/10/22) states staff will be
trained through CPI annually.
2

Analysis Based on interviews conducted and documents reviewed, this
violation is established. Dates of training provided for staff through
TLC confirm there are currently 5 employees out of compliance
with annual training. Supervisor 1 (TLC Program) and Supervisor
2 (Ridgeview Program) confirmed staff are not always completing
CPI refresher trainings within 365 days of previous training.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
